alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 10:40AM CST until January 01 at 6:32PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.2 feet, State Highway J just east of County Road 206 begins to flood near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 19.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 17.6 Thu 10 am 18.1 14.6 13.4 12.9 12.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
